page.title: 04DUNKERTON WILDLIFE
page.content: There is a considerable variety of wildlife in the area. Of the larger mammals foxes, badgers and grey squirrels are common and deer are found away from the village. There are also a lot of bats. Of the birds, Barn owls and little owls are notable and herons will come very close to houses, even to take fish from a pool right next to Church House Dunkerton. In recent years mink have colonised the Cam brook with the result that trout, which were once plentiful are no longer found. The local tree population has been hit hard by the destruction of the elms by Dutch elm disease, and the villagers of Dunkerton have planted about 500 trees of various kinds of native hardwood to replace lost trees
